definition[0]: to persuade someone to do something that they do not want to do by talking to them in a kind, gentle, and patient way
example[0]: ‘Please, Vic, come with us, ’ Nancy coaxed.
example[1]: We had to coax Alan into going to school.
example[2]: We watched the bear coax its cubs to enter the water.
example[3]: Firefighters managed to coax the man down from the roof.
definition[1]: to make something such as a machine do something by dealing with it in a slow, patient, and careful way
example[4]: He coaxed a fire out of some dry grass and twigs.
note[3]: coax something out of/from/into etc something
example[5]: The driver coaxed his bus through the snow.
